title: Bhishma
summary: Bhishma (Sanskrit: भीष्‍म, IAST: Bhīṣma, lit. 'terrible'), also known as Pitamaha, Gangaputra and Devavrata,  was the supreme commander of the Kaurava forces. He is mentioned in the epic Mahabharata. He was the one who witnessed the Mahābhārata completely from the beginning since the reign of king  Shantanu of Kuru kingdom. Bhisma was the grand uncle of both the Pandavas and the Kauravas and statesman of Kuru Kingdom. He was born as the youngest son of the illustrious King Shantanu and Ganga. He was related to both the Pandavas and the Kauravas through his half-brother, Vichitravirya.
